alert.note: Alert for Knox; Waldo (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 20 at 1:26AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Maine, including the following counties, Knox and Waldo. * WHEN...Until 430 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 125 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to heavy showers and embedded thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Camden, Lincolnville, Islesboro, Northport, North Haven, Vinalhaven, Belmont, and Searsmont. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
